 Yes, science uses the observed "results" as a basis for forming a hypothesis. If subsequent data falsifies the hypothesis, well you know.  There is sand -it did not create itself-no human could have created it-there is a supernatural being who did.

 ::long sigh::
 
 1. Evolution (macro and micro) was not postulated to make life conform to an atheistic world-view. That is ridiculous. It was developed to explain the diversity and organization we see in the life on this planet. There were no preconcieved notions. Only questions. It is the creationist that is guilty of this, starting with the premise that the Bible is correct and interpreting evidence to fit the theory. 
 
 2. Matter creating information: matter behaving according to a set of rules (physics) will tend to organize itself in certain ways. On a large scale this allows things like galaxies and solar systems to form. On a small scale, this can lead to a molecule forming that is able to duplicate itself. Is this new information? That depends on your definition, but it is without a doubt order arising from chaos, something which you and many creationists don't seem to think is possible. 
 
 3. To specifically address (what seems to be) your concern about DNA creating new information, you would do well to look into some of the current research on transposons, mobile bits of DNA that can jump from chromosome to chromosome, creating novel genes and, as you would call it, new information.
 
 4. For crying out loud, please learn to use the quotes tool the editor gives you. Many of us are willing to put up with grammar, spelling and even quoting mistakes, but you have had more than enough time to learn to use these tools and we are growing very tired of having to search through your posts to figure out what you're quoting and what you're saying yourself.

 An intelligent being can use the pen to write a code on a piece of paper but it can only be transmitted by the mind that created it to another intelligent being with a mind.
 The paper cannot know the code , it is matter. Information must be understood to be informative does it not?
 
 Information can always be traced back to an intelligent being.
 Matter cannot create , recieve or transmit information. That would violate the laws of science. Give me an example.

Matter cannot trasmit information. Information is a non-material entity.
 ...
 Information can always be traced back to an intelligent being. Matter cannot create , recieve or transmit information. That would violate the laws of science. Give me an example.

 Surely, thou dost jest. What are humans if not matter? Can humans not transmit 'information'? Would you consider a Venus Flytrap an 'intelligent being' when it transmits the 'information' that a fly has landed and it can close its jaws?
 
 Does not DNA transmit 'information' from the parents to the offspring? Do we not know that new 'information' can be created when a mutation occurs? The answer to both questions, of course, is 'yes.' Would you contend that DNA is not matter?
 
 It may help your cause to define the word 'information.' Otherwise, this could easily turn into a debate over semantics. 'Information' could signify a great many things, depending on the context.
